sen.j: 唐揚げ（からあげ、空揚げ）とは、揚げ油を使用した調理方法、またその調理された料理を指す。
sen.e: The tern "Karaage" means a food preparation method using frying oil or food that was prepared by this method.
The term "Karaage" refers to a method of food preparation using frying oil, or the food that is prepared using this method.
The term "Karaage" refers to a method of food preparation using frying oil, or the food that is prepared using this method.

sen.j: 料理例は、鶏肉に小麦粉や片栗粉などを薄くまぶして油で揚げたもの、ワカサギやカレイ、タカサゴ（グルクン）などの白身魚、テナガエビやサクラエビなど小型のエビを利用した物がある。
sen.e: Exemplary foods prepared by this method are fried chicken with thin coating of batter made of flour or katakuriko (potato starch), fried fish using fish with white flesh, such as lake smelt, righteye flounder and double-lined fusiliers (gurukun), and fried shrimp using small-sized prawn such as tenagaebi (oriental river prawn) and sakuraebi (a small pink shrimp).

Examples of food prepared this way include fried chicken with a thin coating of batter made from flour or katakuriko (potato starch), fried fish using white meat fish, such as lake smelt, righteye flounder and double-lined fusiliers (gurukun), and fried shrimp using smaller prawns such as tenagaebi (oriental river prawn) and sakuraebi (a small pink shrimp).

Examples of food prepared this way include fried chicken with a thin coating of batter made from flour or katakuriko (potato starch), fried fish using white meat fish, such as lake smelt, righteye flounder and double-lined fusiliers (gurukun), and fried shrimp using smaller prawns such as tenagaebi (oriental river prawn) and sakuraebi (a small pink shrimp).

sen.j: 天ぷらとは、衣が異なる。
sen.e: Its coating of batter is different from that of tenpura.
The batter used to coat the ingredients is different from that of tempura.
The batter used to coat the ingredients is different from that of tenpura.

sen.j: 竜田揚げ（たつたあげ）という唐揚げによく似た料理がある。
sen.e: Tatsutaage (竜田揚げ) is a similar food to Karaage.
Tatsutaage (竜田揚げ) is similar to Karaage.
Tatsutaage (竜田揚げ) is similar to karaage.
sen.cmt: karaage 小文字に変更しました。

sen.j: 唐揚げは片栗粉と小麦粉を使用し、なおかつ下味ににんにくを使用する。
sen.e: In preparing Karaage, flour and katakuriko are used for coating of batter and garliic is also used for seasoning.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: When preparing Karaage, flour and katakuriko are used in the batter for the coating, and garlic is also used for seasoning.
When preparing karaage, flour and katakuriko are used in the batter for the coating, and garlic is also used for seasoning.
sen.cmt: karaage 小文字に変更しました。

sen.j: これに対して、竜田揚げは肉などを醤油とみりんから作ったタレに漬け込んで下味をつけて片栗粉のみで揚げる。
sen.e: On the other hand, tatsutaage is prepared through the process of seasoning meat with the sauce of soy source and mirin (sweet cooking rice wine), coating it with only katakuriko and frying it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: In contrast, tatsutaage is prepared by seasoning meat with soy sauce and mirin (sweet rice wine for cooking), coating it with just katakuriko and frying it.
In contrast, tatsutaage is prepared by seasoning meat with soy sauce and mirin (sweet rice wine for cooking), coating it with just katakuriko and frying it.

sen.j: 「竜田揚げ」の名前は、百人一首のひとつであり、落語「千早振る」でも有名な在原業平の歌から付けられている。
sen.e: "Tatsutaage" was named after a poem of ARIWARA no Narihira, which is one of Hyakunin Isshu (One Hundred Poems by One Hundred Poets) and famous for the title of rakugo (traditinal commic story0telling) "Chihayaburu".

"Tatsutaage" was named after the poet named ARIWARA no Narihira, who is one of Hyakunin Isshu (One Hundred Poems by One Hundred Poets) and also the title of a famous rakugo (traditional comedic story telling) "Chihayaburu".
sen.cmt: Reword. Uncertain if "ARIWARA no Narihira" is the poet or the title of a poem.
sen.e: The name 'tatsutaage' is derived from the poem read by ARIWARA no Narihira, which was selected in Hyakunin Isshu (One Hundred Poems by One Hundred Poets) and was also the title of a famous rakugo (traditional comedic story telling) 'Chihayaburu.'
sen.cmt: " → ' としました。一部翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: 材料に染み込んだ醤油の色が、揚げることで紅葉のような色合いになるために、紅葉の名所である竜田川に紅葉が流れる姿が連想されるからである。
sen.e: As the color of soy source soaked into material becomes the tone of red leaves after being fried, it reminds people of red leaves floating on Tatsutagawa river, which is the spot of viewing red leaves.

As the soy sauce soaked ingredients are fried, their color becomes the tone of red leaves, which reminds people of red leaves floating on the Tatsutagawa river, a spot where red leaves are often viewed.

As the ingredients soaked in soy-sauce are fried, their color becomes the tone of red leaves, which reminds people of red leaves floating on the Tatsuta-gawa River, a spot where red leaves are often viewed.
sen.cmt: ingredients soaked in soy-sauce としました。

sen.j: また大日本帝国海軍の巡洋艦「龍田 (軽巡洋艦)」の司厨長が、唐揚げを作る際に小麦粉が無かった為代用に片栗粉を用いて揚げた事を由来とする説もある。
sen.e: Some people assert that the name derived from the fact that due to the lack of flour, the chief steward of the cruiser of Imperial Japanese Navy "龍田 (Tatsuta)" (light cruiser) used katakuriko, in substitution of flour, when he prepared Karaage.

Some people assert that the name is derived from the fact that due to a lack of flour, the head chef on a cruiser in the Imperial Japanese Navy "龍田 (Tatsuta)" (light cruiser) used katakuriko, in substitution of flour, when he prepared Karaage.

Some people assert that the name is derived from the fact that due to a lack of flour, the head chef on a cruiser in the Imperial Japanese Navy 'Tatsuta' (龍田) (light cruiser) used katakuriko, in substitution of flour, when he prepared karaage.

sen.j: この説から略字で表記せずに龍田揚げと表記する店もある。
sen.e: Based on the above view, some shops use the Chinese character "龍田揚げ" instead of simpified Chinese character "竜田揚げ".
Based on the above explanation, some shops use the Chinese character in "龍田揚げ" (the same character used for "light cruiser") instead of the simplified Chinese character "竜田揚げ".
Based on the above explanation, some shops use the Chinese character in "龍田揚げ" (the same character used for "light cruiser") instead of the simplified Chinese character "竜田揚げ".

sen.j: 昭和12年発行の軍隊調理法にも記載のあるところから、すでに昭和初期には一般的な料理であったと思われる。
sen.e: It is considered that tatsutaage was already a common food preparation method in the early Showa era since it was listed as one of military food preparetion mentods in the book published in 1937.
It is believed that tatsutaage was already a common method of food preparation in the early Showa era, due to it being listed as a military food preparation method in a book published in 1937.

sen.j: 軟骨唐揚げは、鶏の手羽、または脚の軟骨部分を切り分けて、唐揚げもしくは竜田揚げの手法で調理したもの。
sen.e: Fried gristle is a food prepared by the method of karaage or tatsutaage using chicken wing or gristle of legs as material.
Fried gristle is a dish prepared using the same methods as karaage or tatsutaage, but using chicken wings or the gristle from legs as the main ingredient.

sen.j: 居酒屋メニューとして、ビールのつまみなどにされている。
sen.e: It is one of the dishes of izakaya (Japanese-style bar) and is served as the nibbles for beer.
It is one of the dishes commonly served at izakaya (Japanese-style bar) and is served as a side dish with beer.
It is one of the dishes commonly served at izakaya (Japanese-style bar) and is served as a side dish with beer.

sen.j: 小海老の唐揚げは、殻ごと食べられる程度の小振りのエビを唐揚げの手法で揚げた料理。
sen.e: Fried shrimp is a food prepared by the method of karaage using shrimps which are small enough to eat together with shell.
Fried shrimp is a dish prepared using the same karaage method, but using shrimps small enough to be eaten whole, shell and all.
Fried shrimp is a dish prepared using the same karaage method, but using shrimps small enough to be eaten whole, shell and all.

sen.j: 日本や中国で作られる。
sen.e: It is a popular food in Japan as well as in China.
It is a popular food in Japan as well as in China.
It is a popular food in Japan as well as in China.

sen.j: 淡水産のテナガエビやスジエビ、浅海産のシバエビやトラエビ、深海産のサクラエビ、シラエビ、ジンケンエビなどが用いられる。
sen.e: As material, freshwater shrimps such as tenagaebi and sujiebi (lake prawn), shallow water shrimps such as shibaebi (shiba shrimp) and toraebi (tora velvet shrimp), and deep water shrimps such as sakuraebi, shiraebi (Japanese glass shrimp) and jinkenebi (golden shrimp) are used.

As the main ingredient, freshwater shrimp such as tenagaebi and sujiebi (lake prawn), shallow water shrimp such as shibaebi (shiba shrimp) and toraebi (tora velvet shrimp), and deep water shrimp such as sakuraebi, shiraebi (Japanese glass shrimp) and jinkenebi (golden shrimp) are used.

As the main ingredient, freshwater shrimp such as tenagaebi and sujiebi (lake prawn), shallow water shrimp such as shibaebi (shiba shrimp) and toraebi (tora velvet shrimp), and deep water shrimp such as sakuraebi, shiraebi (Japanese glass shrimp) and jinkenebi (golden shrimp) are used.

sen.j: 南蛮漬け（なんばんづけ）は、唐揚げに「南蛮酢」というネギ・唐辛子（南蛮）の刻みを混ぜた甘酢を掛けた（あるいは漬けた）料理。
sen.e: Nanbanzuke is a food prepared by pouring (or soaking in) "nanbanzu", Japanese sweet vinegar mixed with chopped green onion and red pepper (nanban), on karaage.
Nanbanzuke is a dish prepared by pouring (or soaking in) "nanbanzu", Japanese sweet vinegar mixed with chopped green onion and red pepper (nanban), on karaage.
Nanbanzuke is a dish prepared by pouring (or soaking in) 'nanbanzu,' Japanese sweet vinegar mixed with chopped green onion and red pepper (nanban), on karaage.

sen.j: 掛けるなら西洋料理でいう「エスカベージュ」に、長く漬ければマリネに相当する。
sen.e: When nanabanzu is poured, such food is the equivalent of western food "escabeche", and when karaage is soaked in nanbanzu for long, such food is the equivalent of marinade.
When nanabanzu is poured over karaage, the dish is similar to the Mediterranean dish "escabeche", and when karaage is soaked in nanbanzu for a long time, the dish becomes similar to a marinade.
When nanbanzu is poured over karaage, the dish is similar to the Mediterranean dish 'escabeche,' and when karaage is soaked in nanbanzu for a long time, the dish becomes similar to a marinade.

sen.j: 鶏肉、ワカサギやアジ、イワシなどの魚類でも作られる。
sen.e: Chicken and fish, such as lake smelt, Japanese horse mackrel and sardine, are used as material.
Chicken and fish, such as lake smelt, Japanese horse mackerel and sardines, are also used as ingredients.

sen.j: 唐揚げは日本で人気の高い料理の一つであり、弁当のおかずから酒の肴、子供の誕生日会のおかず等、幅広い場で食べられる。
sen.e: Karaage is a popular food in Japan, and people eat it at a variety of occasions such as a side dish of lunch box, nibbles for drinking and a dish for children's birthday party.

Karaage is a popular food in Japan, and people eat it on a variety of occasions, for example, as a side dish in a boxed lunch, a side dish to go with alcohol and as a dish at a children's birthday party.

sen.j: 定食屋などでは唐揚げ定食が人気メニューの一つとなっている。
sen.e: A set meal with karaage is one of popular dishes at set meal restaurant.
A meal with karaage is a popular choice at restaurants that have pre set meals ready to order.

sen.j: 海水魚の一種タカサゴは、沖縄方言でグルクンと呼ばれる。
sen.e: Takasago, a kind of sea fish, is called gurukun in Okinawa dialect.

sen.j: 南西諸島でよく食べられるが、刺身と並んで唐揚げの人気が高い。
sen.e: People of Nansei islands region regularly eat gurukun, and fried gurukun is popular along with sashimi.
The people of the Nansei islands region regularly eat gurukun, and fried gurukun is popularly eaten with sashimi.

sen.j: 沖縄県では居酒屋の定番メニューとなっている。
sen.e: It is a standard dish at izakaya in Okinawa Prefecture.

sen.j: グルクンを丸ごと揚げることについては、鮮度が落ちやすく、また、淡泊な味であるグルクンを、油で揚げることで日持ちさせ、さらにうまみをつけるという狙いがあると言われている。
sen.e: As gurukun deteriorates fast and its taste is light, it is said that people fry gurukun whole aiming to keep it for long and increase its taste.
As gurukun loses it's freshness quickly and its taste is light, it is said that people fry gurukun whole with the intention of preserving it longer as well as improving its flavor.

sen.j: また、沖縄には「バター焼き」と称する料理があるが、これは日本本土で一般的なムニエルのような切身のバターソテーではなく、マーガリンで風味を付けた魚の丸揚げのことである。
sen.e: A dish called "Bata yaki" (sautéed with butter) in Okinawa is a fish deep-fried whole with margarine flavor, not a fillet sautéed with butter, something like meuniere, which is common in mainland Japan.

sen.j: ザンギは、北海道で作られる鶏や魚介類（タコ、イカ）の唐揚げの一種である。
sen.e: Zangi is a kind of karaage popular in Hokkaido which uses chicken or seafood (octopus, squid) as material.
Zangi is a kind of karaage popular in Hokkaido which uses chicken or seafood (octopus, squid) as the main ingredient.

sen.j: 唐揚げの下味付けの際に、醤油やショウガ、ニンニクなどで濃厚な味付けを施したものであるが、釧路の有名店は味がほとんど付いていない。
sen.e: It is karaage whose material is thickly pre-seasoned with soy source, ginger and garlic, but the one served at famous restaurants in Kushiro is barely seasoned.

sen.j: 一般的に、北海道では釧路市の「鳥松」が発祥の地と言われている。
sen.e: In HokkaidoIt, it is generally believed that its birthplace was "Torimatsu" in Kushiro City.

sen.j: 昭和35年ごろからメニューに入っていたとの証言もある。

sen.j: ただし、戦前(昭和12年)から出されていたとされることから、函館市の「陶陶亭」であったという説もある。
sen.e: On the other hand, some people assert that zangis birthplace should be "Tototei" in Hakodate City because it was already served in the pre-war times (1937).

sen.j: こちらは、関係者が全て故人となり、店も現存していないことから、現在では釧路説が一般的に支持されている。
sen.e: However, Kushiro is commonly believed to be the birthplace since "Tototei" is not existent and no relevant persons are alive.
However, Kushiro is commonly believed to be the birthplace since "Tototei" no longer exists and no relevant people are alive today.

sen.j: 「ザンギ」という名称は上記の鳥松の主人によれば、中国語で鳥の唐揚げを意味する言葉をザーギー（炸鶏）と認識していて、その間に「運がつくように」ウンを入れた、という事である。
sen.e: As for the name of "zangi", the master of Torimatsu said that he thought the Chinese word that means fried chicken was zagi (deep-fried chicken in Chinese) and created the name of "zangi" by inserting the word of 運 (n) (luck) between za and gi in hope of "having a good luck".

As for the name of "zangi", the master of Torimatsu said that he thought the Chinese word for fried chicken was zagi (deep-fried chicken in Chinese) and created the name of "zangi" by inserting the word of 運 (n) (luck) between za and gi in the hope that it would "bring good luck".

As for the name of 'zangi,' the master of Torimatsu said that he thought the Chinese word for fried chicken was zagi (deep-fried chicken in Chinese) and created the name of 'zangi' by inserting the word of 運 (n) (luck) between za and gi in the hope that it would 'bring good luck.'

sen.j: しかし他にも中国語の「炸子鶏」（ジャーズージー。若鶏の唐揚げ）が訛ったものなど諸説がある。
sen.e: Other than the above, however, there are various views such as the one asserting this name is a corrupted form of Chinese word "jazuji" (fried spring chicken).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: さらに、別に発祥とされる店も存在するので正確には不明である。
sen.e: Further, there exists a shop which some people regard as the birthplace, and therefore exact origin of the name of zangi is not clear.

sen.e: Furthermore, there is a shop which some people regard as the birthplace of Zangi, which further confuses the exact origin of the name of zangi.

sen.j: 中国語「炸子鶏」（ジャーズージー）説 （地方によってはザーズーギー、ザージーガイなどとも発音する）
sen.e: A view asserting that the origin is a Chinese word "jazuji" (it is pronounced zazugi or zajigai depending on regions)

sen.j: 中国語「炸鶏」（ジャージー）説 （地方によってはザーギー、ザーガイなどとも発音する）

sen.j: 日本語「散切り」（ザンギリ）説 ※かつて骨ごと切っていた為。
sen.e: A view asserting that the origin is a Japanese word "zangiri" (散切り) * because people cut a chicken bones and all in the past.
One theory asserts that the origin is from the Japanese word "zangiri" (散切り) * because, in the past, people would cut through a chicken bones and all.

sen.j: 日本語「斬切り」（ザンギリ）説 ※同上。
sen.e: A view asserting that the origin is a Japanese word "zangiri" (斬切り) * same with the above.
One theory asserts that the origin is from the Japanese word "zangiri" (斬切り) * same as the above, though, with a slightly different Chinese character.

sen.j: 日本語「千斬切」（センザンキ）説 （中国語としては意味をなさないので当て字であろう）
sen.e: A view asserting that the origin is a Japanese word "senzanki" (千斬切) (it might be phonetic-equivalent character since it is a meaningless Chinese word)
One theory asserts that the origin is from the Japanese word "senzanki" (千斬切) (which might be a character with only a phonetic-equivalent since it has no meaning in Chinese).
One theory asserts that the origin is from the Japanese word 'senzanki' (千斬切) (which might be a character with only a phonetic-equivalent since it has no meaning in Chinese).

sen.j: 仏教用語で、年端もいかない若鶏を殺生して調理する行いを恥じよという思いを込め「慚愧」（ザンギ）説
sen.e: A view asserting that people used a Buddhist terminology "zangi" (慚愧) since they were ashamed of killing and cooking young chicken.
One theory asserts that people used the Buddhist terminology "zangi" (慚愧) because they were ashamed of killing and cooking young chickens.

sen.j: 「残毀」説（肉を切る＝毀 → 唐揚げする → 味付けを止める残）
sen.e: A view asserting that the origin is a Japanese word "zanki" (残毀) (cutting meat = 毀 => frying =>stop seasoning = 残
sen.cmt: 味付けを止める残→意味がよく分かりませんので、仮訳しております。
sen.e: Yet another theory asserts that the origin is from the Japanese word "zanki" (残毀) (cutting meat = 毀 => frying =>stop seasoning = 残).
Yet another theory asserts that the origin is from the Japanese word 'zanki' (残毀) (cutting meat = 毀 => frying =>stop seasoning = 残).

sen.j: 釧路市を含めて北海道各地には戦後、中国、満州からの引揚者が多く移り住んだことと関係があるのではないかとする説もある。
sen.e: Some people assert that the way of naming might be related to the fact that many people who returned from China and Manchuria after the War settled in Hokkaido including Kushiro City.
Some people assert the reason behind its name might be related to the large number of people who, after the war, returned from China and Manchuria and settled in Hokkaido, including Kushiro City.
Some people assert the reason behind its name might be related to the large number of people who, after the war, returned from China and Manchuria and settled in Hokkaido, including Kushiro City.

sen.j: また、炸子鶏と共通する部分として、衣に片栗粉を使うことが「ザンギ」の条件であるとする説もある。
sen.e: Some people further assert that the name of "zangi" should be used only for foods which use katakuriko for a coating of batter since it is a common feature with jazuji.
Some people also assert that the name "zangi" should only be used for food that uses katakuriko in the batter for the coating, since this is a common feature with jazuji.
Some people also assert that the name 'zangi' should only be used for food that uses katakuriko in the batter for the coating, since this is a common feature with jazuji.

sen.j: また、衣に卵を使うものを限定して「ザンギ」をする地方もある。
sen.e: In some region, only the food which uses egg for a coating of batter is called "zangi".
In some regions, only food prepared using egg in the batter for the coating is called "zangi".
In some regions, only food prepared using egg in the batter for the coating is called 'zangi.'

sen.j: 北海道民の中には、唐揚げ＝鶏肉のザンギであると認識している人もおり、北海道の居酒屋のメニューにはザンギが含まれているのが一般的である。
sen.e: Some people in Hokkaido identify karaage with chicken zangi and zangi is normally included in the menu of izakaya in Hokkaido.
Some people in Hokkaido identify karaage with chicken as zangi, and zangi is normally included in the menu at most izakaya in Hokkaido.
Some people in Hokkaido identify karaage with chicken as zangi, and zangi is normally included in the menu at most izakaya in Hokkaido.

sen.j: そのため、ザンギを北海道独特の物、或いは名称であると認識していない北海道民も存在する。
sen.e: Therefore, some people in Hokkaido don't recognize zangi as Hokkaido's unique food or its name.
Therefore, some people in Hokkaido don't recognize zangi, or the term, as being unique to Hokkaido.
Therefore, some people in Hokkaido don't recognize zangi, or the term, as being unique to Hokkaido.

sen.j: このため、全国展開している大手のコンビニエンスストアでも、北海道内の店舗では、鶏肉のから揚げ商品にザンギの名称を用いて販売している。
sen.e: Under such circumstances, even national chain supermarkets are selling fried chicken under the name of zangi at their stores in Hokkaido.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Due to this, even national chain supermarkets in Hokkaido are selling fried chicken under the name of "zangi."
Due to this, even national chain supermarkets in Hokkaido are selling fried chicken under the name of zangi.
sen.cmt: ダブルクォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: また、札幌市で創業した居酒屋チェーン「つぼ八」でも、鶏肉のから揚げ商品にザンギの名称を用いている。
sen.e: "Tsubohachi", izakaya which originally started business in Sapporo City, is also providing fried chicken under the name of zangi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: "Tsubohachi", an izakaya which originally started business in Sapporo City, also provides fried chicken under the name of zangi.
An izakaya named 'Tsubohachi,' which originally started business in Sapporo City, also provides fried chicken under the name of zangi.

sen.j: 鶏肉以外の場合は、「蛸のザンギ」など材料名を付して呼ぶことが一般的である。
sen.e: When other materials than chicken are used, such food is normally called by the name with the name of material attached like "zangi of octopus".
When ingredients other than chicken are used, the dish is normally referred to by the name of the ingredient used. Such as "Octopus zangi."
When ingredients other than chicken are used, the dish is normally referred to by the name of the ingredient used, such as 'Octopus zangi.'

sen.j: しかし、弁当の販売店の中には「から揚げ」として売られているほか、日清製粉の「から揚げ粉」も古くから売られている。
sen.e: However, some lunch box shops are using the name of "karaage" and "Karaageko" (karaage powder), a product of Nisshin Seifun Inc., has been on sale from long ago.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: However, some bento (boxed lunch) shops have been selling products using the name "karaage" and "Karaageko" (karaage powder), a product of Nisshin Seifun Inc., for some time.

However, some bento (boxed lunch) shops have been selling products using the name 'karaage'; also, karaage powder named 'Karaageko' which is a product of Nisshin Seifun Inc., have been sold for some time.

sen.j: このように、から揚げとザンギを別物として認識している人もいる。
sen.e: As seen from the above, there also exist people who distinguish karaage from zangi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: As seen above, there are some people who distinguish karaage from zangi.
As seen above, there are some people who distinguish karaage from zangi.

sen.j: その場合は、ザンギ＝鶏の竜田揚げ、もしくは生姜味（風味）を強くしたから揚げと言う意味になる。
sen.e: In this case, zangi means chicken tatsutaage or karaage with stronger ginger flavor (flavor).
In this case, zangi refers to chicken tatsutaage or karaage with a strong ginger flavor.
In this case, zangi refers to chicken tatsutaage or karaage with a strong ginger flavor.

sen.j: また、「ザンギ」を「唐揚げの意味」とする北海道弁の解説書、サイトなどがあるが、上記の通り、これは厳密には間違いである。
sen.e: Although some books or websites on the dialect of Hokkaido explain that "zangi means karaage", it is not correct to be exact as mentioned above.
Although some books or websites on the dialect of Hokkaido state that "zangi means karaage", this is not technically correct as explained above.
Although some books or websites on the dialect of Hokkaido state that 'zangi means karaage,' this is not technically correct as explained above.

sen.j: 愛媛県今治市では揚げる前にタレに漬けて味付けした鶏の唐揚げを「せんざんき」（「千斬切」の字も当てられる）、東予地方では同じものを「ざんき」と呼ぶ。
sen.e: In Imabari City, Ehime Prefecture, fried chicken using chicken that was pre-seasoned by soaling in sauce is called "senzanki" (Chinese character "千斬切" is also used), and the same food is called "zanki" in Toyo region.

In Imabari City, Ehime Prefecture, fried chicken made with chicken that was pre-seasoned by being soaked in sauce is called "senzanki" (The Chinese characters "千斬切" are also used), and this same dish is called "zanki" in the Toyo region.

In Imabari City, Ehime Prefecture, fried chicken made with chicken that was pre-seasoned by being soaked in sauce is called 'senzanki' (the Chinese characters '千斬切' are also used), and this same dish is called 'zanki' in the Toyo region.

sen.j: しかしこれらとの関係は不明である。
sen.e: However, it is not clear how the above related to zangi in Hokkaido.
However, it is unclear how the above mentioned dish is related to zangi in Hokkaido.
However, it is unclear how the above mentioned dish is related to zangi in Hokkaido.

tit.j: 大分県中津市のからあげ
tit.e: Karaage in Nakatsu City, Oita Prefecture
Karaage in Nakatsu City, Oita Prefecture
Karaage in Nakatsu City, Oita Prefecture

sen.j: 大分県中津市は鶏肉唐揚げを好む人が非常に多く、市内や近郊の宇佐市、福岡県豊前市・築上郡には非常に多くの唐揚げ専門店が存在し、その味を競っている。
sen.e: There are so many people who love fried chicken in Nakatsu City, Oita Prefecture, and so many karaage restaurants located inside the city, in neighboring Usa City and Buzen City/Chikujogun, Fukuoka Prefecture are competing each other over their taste.

There are so many people who love fried chicken in Nakatsu City, Oita Prefecture, and so many karaage restaurants located inside the city, that neighboring Usa City and Buzen City/Chikujogun, Fukuoka Prefecture have begun competing with each other over the taste of their fried chicken.

There are so many people who love fried chicken in Nakatsu City, Oita Prefecture, and so many karaage restaurants located inside the city, that neighboring Usa City and Buzen City/Chikujo-gun, Fukuoka Prefecture have begun competing with each other over the taste of their fried chicken.

sen.j: 中国
sen.e: China
China
China

sen.j: 中国料理の場合は、揚げたあとに、餡やたれをかけることも多い。
sen.e: In the case of Chinese cuisine, thick starcy source or soup is often poured after frying.
In Chinese cuisine, thick starchy sauce or soup is often poured over the dish after it is fried.
In Chinese cuisine, thick starchy sauce or soup is often poured over the dish after it is fried.

sen.j: 油淋鶏（ユーリンチー）は、鶏の唐揚げに、刻んだネギをたっぷり入れた酢と醤油のタレをかけた中華料理のひとつ。
sen.e: Yurinchi is a Chinese cuisine which is prepared by pouring sauce, which is made of vinegar, soy sauce and a plenty of chopped white onion, on fried chicken.
Yurinchi is a Chinese dish which is prepared by pouring vinegar sauce, soy sauce and plenty of chopped white onions, on fried chicken.
Yurinchi is a Chinese dish which is prepared by pouring vinegar sauce, soy sauce and plenty of chopped white onions, on fried chicken.

sen.j: 鶏の唐揚げネギソースがけなどと呼ぶ店もある。
sen.e: It is called fried chicken with white onion sauce at some restaurants.
It is called fried chicken with white onion sauce at some restaurants.
It is called fried chicken with white onion sauce at some restaurants.

sen.j: 粉をつけず油をかけながら皮をパリッとさせるのが本来の調理方法である。
sen.e: Its original method of cooking is to fry chicken with no flour courting while pouring oil so that chicken's skin becomes crisp.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The original method for cooking Yurinchi is to fry chicken without a flour coating while pouring oil over it so that the chicken's skin becomes crisp.
The original method for cooking yurinchi is to fry chicken without a flour coating while pouring oil over it so that the chicken's skin becomes crisp.
sen.cmt: yurinchi 小文字としました。

sen.j: しかし、調理時間の短縮やソースがからみやすい等の理由で、粉をまぶして揚げたものについても油淋鶏として紹介される事が多い。
sen.e: However, the one which is fried after being coated with flour is also often introduced as yurinchi because the original method is time-consuming and sauce tends to be twined around chicken while cooking.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: However, the variation of this dish that is fried after being coated with flour is also often referred to as yurinchi, due to the fact that the original method is time-consuming and the sauce tends to become stuck to the chicken while cooking

However, the variation of this dish that is fried after being coated with flour is also often referred to as yurinchi, due to the fact that the original method is time-consuming and the sauce tends to become stuck to the chicken while cooking.

sen.j: 檸檬鶏（レンモンカイ）は、鶏の唐揚げに、レモンの絞り汁、砂糖、醤油などで作ったタレをかけた広東料理のひとつ。
sen.e: Remonkai is a Cantonese food prepared by pouring sauce, which is made of lemon juice, sugar and soy sauce etc., on fried chicken.

sen.j: 辣子鶏（ラーズージー）は、若鶏の唐揚げとともに、赤唐辛子を素揚げにして、刻んで塩と共に振りかけた四川料理のひとつ。
sen.e: Razuji is a Szechuan food which is prepared by spreading, together with salt, fried chopped red pepper on fried spring chicken.
Razuji is an example of Szechuan cuisine which is prepared by spreading, together with salt, fried chopped red pepper on fried spring chicken.

sen.j: モチコチキンは下味をつけた鶏肉にもち米の粉（白玉粉）をまぶして揚げたハワイの料理。
sen.e: Mochikochikin is a Hawaiian food which is prepared by frying pre-seasoned chicken with glutinous rice powder (shiratamako (refined rice powder)) coating.
